abort.already_configured: The gateway on this port has already been configured.
abort.no_serial_ports: No serial ports found. Please connect your gateway and try again.

error.cannot_connect: Cannot connect to the device at this port
error.invalid_id: The ID must be in the format XX-XX-XX-XX where X is a hexadecimal digit (0-9, A-F)

data_description.auto_reconnect: If selected the gateway automatically tries to reconnect after the connection is lost.
data_description.fast_status_change: It takes some time for the Eltako actuators to send a confirmation once a command has been send. Therefore this option will directly change the state in the UI, to create a more responsive expereince.
data_description.id:
This is the base ID of the gateway. The sending IDs will be based on it.
This is not the device's ID inside the Eltako BUS.
For wired devices it is recommended to use (00-00-B0-00)
For wireless devices like the USB300 you need to add its own base ID (FF-XX-XX-XX).
data_description.message_delay: The delay between two sending messages to prevent buffer overflow on the gateway.
data_description.name: The name of the gateway visible in the GUI.
data_description.serial_port: The USB port, where the gateway is connected.

abort.model_not_found: Reconfiguration failed. The device model was not found.

device.entry_type: Device that is connected via the gateway.

error.already_configured: A device with this ID is already configured for this gateway.
error.invalid_cover_time: You need to fill either no or both cover times (open and close).
error.invalid_id: The ID must be in the format XX-XX-XX-XX where X is a hexadecimal digit (0-9, A-F)
